issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: Studio
components.description: Please enter tickets related to Titanium Studio here.

fields.description:
Error encountered during update
An error occurred while uninstalling
session context was:(profile=profile, phase=org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.engine.phases.Uninstall, operand=[R]com.appcelerator.titanium.feature.rcp_root 3.2.3.201404290739-837YFA8FFBdX_z0Kz0x6oEDEGA48 --> null, action=org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.touchpoint.natives.actions.CleanupzipAction).
Backup of file /opt/titanium-studio/configuration/.settings/org.eclipse.equinox.p2.metadata.repository.prefs failed.
File that was copied to backup could not be deleted: /opt/titanium-studio/configuration/.settings/org.eclipse.equinox.p2.metadata.repository.prefs
fields.summary: Titanium studio won't update to 3.4.0 beta

comments.body: Deleting the file manually doesn't fix the issue.
Have you tried this more recently?

Yes. The problem happens also with the update to 3.5.0.

Error encountered during update
An error occurred while uninstalling
session context was:(profile=profile, phase=org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.engine.phases.Uninstall, operand=[R]com.appcelerator.titanium.feature.rcp_root 3.4.0.201409261227-827bFA2FF7cLVuUtuFNtX8GB189I --> null, action=org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.touchpoint.natives.actions.CleanupzipAction).
Backup of file /opt/titanium-studio/configuration/.settings/org.eclipse.equinox.p2.metadata.repository.prefs failed.
File that was copied to backup could not be deleted: /opt/titanium-studio/configuration/.settings/org.eclipse.equinox.p2.metadata.repository.prefs

Restarting Titanium Studio as root and performing the update seems to work.

This issue also happens with update to 4.0.0

https://community.appcelerator.com/topic/220/studio-update-windows-error

[~fokkezb] I believe the issue is people installed as administrator, and then need to update as administrator. It appears to be a permission issue. "Restarting Titanium Studio as root and performing the update seems to work."
So could we inform users about that when we don't have permission to delete that file? Suggest them to start Studio as root?
I don't know if that's the _only_ file that will cause that problem [~cwilliams], thoughts?
